concept.title: Permanent Generation Size
concept.shortdesc: When you use with Java 7, you can define the Java Permanent Generation size, also known as the PermGen size.

conbody.p: Java configuration optionsPermGen sizePermGen sizeconfiguringThe PermGen size determines the amount of memory that the web application server uses. Define the PermGen size as part of the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable in the environment configuration file.

Use the following properties to define the PermGen size:
MaxPermSize - Set to 1/4 of the Java heap size, with a minimum of 128 MB.
PermSize - Set to 1/8 of the Java heap size, with a minimum of 128 MB.
Setting the properties higher than these guidelines can cause out of memory errors or cause to fail to start.
By default, the PermGen size is defined as follows:SDC_JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -Xms1024m -XX:PermSize=128M -XX:MaxPermSize=256M -server ${SDC_JAVA_OPTS}"
If, for example, you doubled the heap size to 2048 MB, you might set the options as follows: SDC_JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx2048m -Xms1048m -XX:PermSize=256M -XX:MaxPermSize=512M -server ${SDC_JAVA_OPTS} "
